Detailed Description

The FAX Interface.

FAX/MODEM tone detection

The VoIP common codecs (G.729 and G.723) are not suitable for FAX or MODEM application.
This page introduce the FAX/MODEM tone detection. VoIP can switch to FoIP or MoIP after the FAX/MDM event. The FoIP can switch back to VoIP after FAX End event rtk_GetFaxEndDetect.
There are two common groups of FAX (ITU T.30).

  • Group 3, up to 14400bps transfer rate
  • Super Group 3, up to 33600bps transfrer rate
Group 3 can transmit through T.38 or T.30(G.711 pass-through) protocol.
Super Group 3 transmit through T.30(G.711 pass-through) protocol.
For more T.38 information see TAPI_MEDIA - T.38. Common Modem Standard

  • ITU V.21 (300bps)
  • ITU V.22bis (1200-2400bps)
  • ITU V.23 (600-1200bps)
  • ITU V.27ter, ITU V.29, ITU V.17 (2400-14400bps). Used in Group 3 Fax, too.
  • ITU V.34, ITU V.90 (up to 5600bps)
  • Bell 103 (300bps), Bell 202 (1200bps)

Figure . Do re-INVITE after fax or modem detection 

 
uint32 fax_modem, fax_event;
rtk_GetFaxModemEvent(0, &fax_modem, &fax_event, 0);
if ( (fax_modem == FMS_FAX_LOW_SPEED) || (fax_modem == FMS_FAX_HIGH_SPEED) )
{
    /*do FAX T.38 or pass-through re-INVITE*/
    ...
} else if ( fax_modem == FMS_MODEM_LOCAL ) {
    /*do Modem pass-through re-INVITE*/
    ...
}
The functions of rtk_SetAnswerToneDet set detection of cng, ans, /ans, ansam, /ansam etc ... call rtk_OnHookReinit to reinit the detection
The functions of rtk_SetVbdEc set the Echo Canceller Mode for VBD (FAX/MODEM) application

FAX/MODEM Tones, signals and events

  • FAX Tones, signals and events
  • Modem Tones, signals and events


Notes: Disable AGC and set proper volume in VBD(FAX/Modem) connection.
Reference:

  • ITU T.30, T.38
  • ITU V.21, V.22bis, V.23
  • ITU V.27ter, V.29, V.17
  • ITU V.34, V.90
  • ITU V.8bis, V.25
  • Bell 103, 202
  • RFC 2833 - Internet Engineering Task Force

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum FAX_MODEM_STATE

Enumeration for fax state

Enumerator
FMS_IDLE 

0 - IDLE

FMS_FAX_LOW_SPEED 

1 - FAX_CED

FMS_FAX_HIGH_SPEED 

2 - FAX_DIS_RX

FMS_MODEM_LOCAL 

3 - MODEM_LOCAL

FMS_MODEM_REMOTE 

4 - MODEM_REMOTE

FMS_V21_FLAG 

5 - EVENT_V21FLAG_LOCAL

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_GetFaxModemEvent ( uint32  chid,
uint32 *  pval,
VoipEventID *  pevent,
uint32  flush 
)

Fax/Modem detection, report CED tone , ANSam tone, V.21 DIS event.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
pvalThe translated fax state, see FAX_MODEM_STATE.
peventThe raw fax state. (0 means no event)
flushFlush
1: Flush the FIFO
0: Do nothing
Return values
0Success
Examples:
fxo.c.
int32 rtk_SetFaxModemDet ( uint32  chid,
uint32  mode 
)

Fax/Modem detect configuration.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
modeThe Fax/Modem detect mode.

Detect mode Index
Auto-Hi-Speed-Fax 0
Fax 1
Modem 2
Auto-Low-Speed-Fax 3
Note
the mode default is 0
Return values
0Success
Examples:
fxo.c.
int32 rtk_GetFaxEndDetect ( uint32  chid,
uint32 *  pval 
)

Get Fax end detection result.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
*pvalIt will return the result of the fax end detection.
0: No Fax end
1: Fax end detected
Return values
0Success
Examples:
fxo.c.

uint32 *  pval

Get Fax Dis TX event detection result.

Parameters

*pvalIt will return the result of DIS Tx detection, transmit path(IP/RTP/Remote).
